content: Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}

comment.text: The translation key "ConfirmEmailSended" is used to display a success message after sending a confirmation email to an owner. It appears in a success notification dialogue, informing the user that a confirmation email has been sent to the selected owner. The message includes the owner's name for personalization.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Təsdiqləmə e-məktubu {{ownerName}} göndərilmişdir' is not the most natural way to express 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}'. It literally translates to 'Confirmation e-mail {{ownerName}} has been sent'.
The placement of the variable {{ownerName}} is slightly awkward. It sounds more natural to incorporate it within the sentence flow.
Missing space after 'odeslán'. The Czech language typically requires a space after verbs like 'odeslán'.
While technically correct, 'Potvrzující e-mail' sounds slightly unnatural. A more common and natural phrasing would be 'Email pro potvrzení'.
The word 'Bestätiguns' is misspelled. It should be 'Bestätigungs'.

The translation 'Το e-mail επιβεβαίωσης έχει σταλεί στον χρήστη {{ownerName}}' literally translates to 'The confirmation email has been sent to the user {{ownerName}}'. While technically correct, it's not the most natural or idiomatic way to express this in Greek. A more natural phrasing would be something like 'Έχει σταλεί email επιβεβαίωσης στον {{ownerName}}' or 'Το email επιβεβαίωσης έχει αποσταλεί στον {{ownerName}}'.
The phrase 'Confirmation e-mail' is not accurately translated. 'Vahvistusviesti' is closer to 'confirmation message' rather than 'confirmation email'.
The sentence structure could be improved for better flow in Finnish. Using 'osoitteeseen' instead of 'osoitteen' would be more grammatically correct.

The translation 'Un messaggio e-mail di conferma è stato spedito a {{ownerName}}' is a bit too literal and formal. A more natural Italian phrasing would be 'È stata inviata un'e-mail di conferma a {{ownerName}}' or 'Abbiamo inviato un'e-mail di conferma a {{ownerName}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Abbiamo inviato un'e-mail di conferma a {{ownerName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Dutch translation 'Bevestiging e-mail is gestuurd naar {{ownerName}}' is a literal translation and sounds unnatural. 'Bevestiging' (confirmation) is not typically used in this context. A more natural phrasing would be 'Er is een bevestigingse-mail verstuurd naar...' or 'Een bevestigingsmail is verstuurd naar...'
While understandable, the use of 'is gestuurd' can be improved. It's more common to use a verb tense that emphasizes the action of sending.

The Romanian translation "Un mesaj pentru confirmarea adresei de email a fost trimis către {{ownerName}}" is not an accurate translation of "Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}". It's too verbose and uses awkward phrasing. A more natural translation would be something like "Email de confirmare a fost trimis către {{ownerName}}" or "A fost trimis un email de confirmare către {{ownerName}}".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Email de confirmare a fost trimis către {{ownerName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "තහවුරු කිරීමේ වි-තැපෑල {{ownerName}} වෙත යවා ඇත" is a literal translation that doesn't flow naturally in Sinhala. A more natural phrasing would be '{{ownerName}} වෙත තහවුරු කිරීමේ ලිපිය යවා ඇත' or 'තහවුරු කිරීමේ ලිපිය {{ownerName}} වෙත යවා ඇත'. The use of 'වි-තැපෑල' is not commonly used.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: තහවුරු කිරීමේ ලිපිය {{ownerName}} වෙත යවා ඇත

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While the variable `{{ownerName}}` is present, the formatting consistency with English should be considered. Ensure this variable is handled consistently across all translations.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Maintain the same variable format as the English version.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Potvrdzujúci mail bol odoslaný {{ownerName}}' is a literal translation that isn't the most natural or idiomatic way to express 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}' in Slovak. A better translation would convey the meaning more clearly and sound more natural.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural translation would be: 'Bol vám odoslaný potvrdenie na e-mail {{ownerName}}' or 'Potvrdenie bolo zaslané na e-mail {{ownerName}}'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Емаил конфирмације је послат {{ownerName}}' is a literal and awkward translation. A more natural and accurate translation would be 'Е-маил за потврду је послат {{ownerName}}' or 'Послата је е-маил за потврду на адресу {{ownerName}}'.
While 'Емаил' is sometimes used, the preferred and more common spelling in Serbian is 'Е-маил'.

The translation 'Email konfirmacije je poslat {{ownerName}}' is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}".  'Konfirmacije' implies an email *of* confirmation, rather than a confirmation email.
The verb 'poslat' is generally used in a more informal context. A more formal and widely accepted form would be 'poslat'.

The Turkish translation 'Onay e-postası şu kişiye gönderildi {{ownerName}}' is not a natural or accurate translation of 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}'. A more natural translation would be something like 'Onay e-postası {{ownerName}} adresine gönderildi' or '{{ownerName}} adresine onay e-postası gönderildi'.

The translation 'Електронний лист-підтвердження надіслано {{ownerName}}' is a literal translation but sounds awkward in Ukrainian. A more natural phrasing would be 'Підтвердження надіслано на електронну пошту {{ownerName}}' or 'На {{ownerName}} надіслано лист-підтвердження'.
